One interesting point is the inclusion of elder brothers for "filial" service, and the other is the exclusion of mothers and ancestors. The section is pragmatically focussed on an opposition to the traditional tendency to understate the duties of filial devotion by those who have left the household for some outside business. The dispute is very concrete and simple, down-to-earth and pragmatic. One can easily imagine that this actually represented one of WT's real historical preoccupations.】
